definition: to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
repeatedly/back and forth again and again
returning to our main topic,.../that said,.../again,.../in this connection/in passing/nevertheless,.../anyhow
returning to our main topic,.../that said,.../again,.../in this connection/in passing/nevertheless,.../anyhow
to earn back (money one invested, wasted etc)

sentences.english: I cabled her, but we've been at sea.
sentences.chinese: 他打电报通知我他很快就会回来。

sentences.english: LJ says his parents aren’t home, but they will be soon.
sentences.chinese: LJ告诉他父母并不在家，但很快会回来的。

sentences.english: Don’t be tempted to leave any of the purchase on the counters.
sentences.chinese: 不要试图把买回来的东西放在台子上。

sentences.english: Can I manage to make it back in one piece?
sentences.chinese: 我可否设法把它一次搬回来？

sentences.english: And I will bring again the captivity of Egypt, and will cause them to return into the land of Pathros, into the land of their habitation; and they shall be there a base kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 我必叫埃及被掳的人回来，使他们归回本地巴忒罗。

sentences.english: Dear colleagues, a pleasant journey, I remember thinking of us, always come back together sometime.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的同事，一路顺风，记得想念我们，常回来聚聚。

sentences.english: The village leader, Mr. Tian, asks Wei Minzhi to take Mr. Gao's place until he comes back.
sentences.chinese: 田村长让魏敏芝替高老师代课，直到他回来。

sentences.english: She was asked by her mother to go to buy apples at the greengrocer's at the corner.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲要她到转角的蔬菜店去买些苹果回来。

sentences.english: Part of that revenue loss, however, would be recouped through other taxes.
sentences.chinese: 但是，这些税收的部分损失将从别的税种上补偿回来。

sentences.english: In 1768 his big chance for a major expedition came.
sentences.chinese: 1768年，他最大的运气就是主要的远征回来了。

sentences.english: When did you get back from Canada?
sentences.chinese: 你什么时候从加拿大回来的？

sentences.english: Mrs. Jennings soon appeared, and the note being given her, she read it aloud.
sentences.chinese: 詹宁斯太太很快回来了，一接到信便大声读了起来。

sentences.english: I wash the vegetable and you should do it over before I come back.
sentences.chinese: 我去洗菜，在我回来之前，你要将火生好。

sentences.english: "But how came you to our house?" asked one.
sentences.chinese: “但是你怎么回来到我们的房子？”其中一个问到。

definition: to come over/to manage/to handle/to be able to take care of
to go back to one's roots/to return to one's native place/by ext. to join one's ancestors (i.e. to die)
to come up/to approach/(verb complement indicating success)
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
to turn round/to turn one's head/later/by and by
(after a verb, indicates coming out, completion of an action, or ability to discern or detect)
to be finished/to be done for/ruined/gone to the dogs/oh no
